description: HCT116 colorectal cancer cell lines are heterozygous for c.3380C>A and sensitive to PARP inhibition following shRNA depletion of ATM. Deletion of p53 enhances sensitivity.
citation: Wang C, Jette N, Moussienko D, Bebb DG, Lees-Miller SP. ATM-Deficient Colorectal Cancer Cells Are Sensitive to the PARP Inhibitor Olaparib Translational Oncology. 2017; 10(2):190-196.

description: Loss of antigen presentation via B2M loss of function mutations results in increased survival of cancer cells in the presence of tumor infiltrating lymphocytes.
citation: Patel SJ, Sanjana NE, Kishton RJ, et al. Identification of essential genes for cancer immunotherapy Nature. 2017; 548(7669):537-542.

description: shRNA knockout in ovarian cancer suggests suggests sensitivity to PARP1/2 inhibition, specifically olaparib.
citation: Bajrami I, Frankum JR, Konde A, et al. Genome-wide profiling of genetic synthetic lethality identifies CDK12 as a novel determinant of PARP1/2 inhibitor sensitivity. Cancer Res. 2014;74(1):287-97.

description: siRNA knockout, "gene depletion", of CDK12 shows sensitivity to PARP inhibitor veliparib in ovarian cancer cell lines.
citation: Joshi PM, Sutor SL, Huntoon CJ, Karnitz LM. Ovarian cancer-associated mutations disable catalytic activity of CDK12, a kinase that promotes homologous recombination repair and resistance to cisplatin and poly(ADP-ribose) polymerase inhibitors. J Biol Chem. 2014;289(13):9247-53.

description: CPT1A is involved in fatty acid oxidation, a key component of some tumor's metabolic processes. CPT1A knockdown in some melanoma BRAF V600E cell lines resulted in decreased proliferation and tumorigenesis.
citation: Sung GJ, Choi HK, Kwak S, et al. Targeting CPT1A enhances metabolic therapy in human melanoma cells with the BRAF V600E mutation. Int J Biochem Cell Biol. 2016;81(Pt A):76-81.

description: RNAi knockdown of RAD17 in the HME-CC breast cancer cell line resulted in increased sensitivity to ABT-888, Veliparib (PARP inhibitor). If RAD50 is also knocked out, a further increase in sensitivity is observed.
citation: Weigman VJ, Chao HH, Shabalin AA, et al. Basal-like Breast cancer DNA copy number losses identify genes involved in genomic instability, response to therapy, and patient survival. Breast Cancer Res Treat. 2012;133(3):865-80.

description: RNAi knockdown of RAD17 in the HME-CC breast cancer cell line resulted in increased sensitivity to carboplatin. A further increase in sensitivity occurred when knocked down with RAD50.
citation: Weigman VJ, Chao HH, Shabalin AA, et al. Basal-like Breast cancer DNA copy number losses identify genes involved in genomic instability, response to therapy, and patient survival. Breast Cancer Res Treat. 2012;133(3):865-80.

description: RNAi knockdown of RAD50 in the HME-CC breast cancer cell line resulted in increased resistance to carboplatin.
citation: Weigman VJ, Chao HH, Shabalin AA, et al. Basal-like Breast cancer DNA copy number losses identify genes involved in genomic instability, response to therapy, and patient survival. Breast Cancer Res Treat. 2012;133(3):865-80.

description: Loss of antigen presentation via TAP2 loss of function mutations results in increased survival of cancer cells in the presence of tumor infiltrating lymphocytes.
citation: Patel SJ, Sanjana NE, Kishton RJ, et al. Identification of essential genes for cancer immunotherapy Nature. 2017; 548(7669):537-542.
